verses.kjv: Now the LORD had said unto Abram, Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and from thy father’s house, unto a land that I will shew thee:
verses.ct: The LORD had told Abram, "Leave your country, your relatives, and your father's household, and go to a land that I will show you.

verses.kjv: And I will make of thee a great nation, and I will bless thee, and make thy name great; and thou shalt be a blessing:
verses.ct: I will turn you into a great nation. I will bless you and make your name famous, and you will be a blessing to others.

verses.kjv: And I will bless them that bless thee, and curse him that curseth thee: and in thee shall all families of the earth be blessed.
verses.ct: I will bless those who bless you, and I will curse anyone who curses you. Through you, every family on earth will be blessed."

verses.kjv: So Abram departed, as the LORD had spoken unto him; and Lot went with him: and Abram was seventy and five years old when he departed out of Haran.
verses.ct: So Abram left, just as the LORD had told him, and Lot went along with him. Abram was 75 years old when he left Haran.

verses.kjv: And Abram took Sarai his wife, and Lot his brother’s son, and all their substance that they had gathered, and the souls that they had gotten in Haran; and they went forth to go into the land of Canaan; and into the land of Canaan they came.
verses.ct: Abram took his wife Sarai, his nephew Lot, all the possessions they had accumulated, and the people they had acquired in Haran. They set out for the land of Canaan, and they arrived there.

verses.kjv: And Abram passed through the land unto the place of Sichem, unto the plain of Moreh. And the Canaanite was then in the land.
verses.ct: Abram traveled through the land as far as the site of Shechem, at the oak of Moreh. The Canaanites were living in the land at that time.

verses.kjv: And the LORD appeared unto Abram, and said, Unto thy seed will I give this land: and there builded he an altar unto the LORD, who appeared unto him.
verses.ct: The LORD appeared to Abram and said, "I will give this land to your descendants." So Abram built an altar there to the LORD, who had appeared to him.

verses.kjv: And he removed from thence unto a mountain on the east of Bethel, and pitched his tent, having Bethel on the west, and Hai on the east: and there he builded an altar unto the LORD, and called upon the name of the LORD.
verses.ct: From there he moved on to the hill country east of Bethel and set up camp, with Bethel to the west and Hai to the east. There he built an altar to the LORD and worshiped the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Abram journeyed, going on still toward the south.
verses.ct: Then Abram continued traveling, making his way steadily toward the southern region.

verses.kjv: And there was a famine in the land: and Abram went down into Egypt to sojourn there; for the famine was grievous in the land.
verses.ct: Now a famine struck the land, and Abram traveled down to Egypt to live there for a while, because the famine was severe.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when he was come near to enter into Egypt, that he said unto Sarai his wife, Behold now, I know that thou art a fair woman to look upon:
verses.ct: As he was approaching Egypt, he said to his wife Sarai, "Listen, I know that you are a very beautiful woman.

verses.kjv: Therefore it shall come to pass, when the Egyptians shall see thee, that they shall say, This is his wife: and they will kill me, but they will save thee alive.
verses.ct: When the Egyptians see you, they will say, 'She's his wife,' and they will kill me but let you live.

verses.kjv: Say, I pray thee, thou art my sister: that it may be well with me for thy sake; and my soul shall live because of thee.
verses.ct: Please tell them you are my sister, so that things will go well for me because of you, and my life will be spared on your account."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that, when Abram was come into Egypt, the Egyptians beheld the woman that she was very fair.
verses.ct: When Abram arrived in Egypt, the Egyptians noticed that Sarai was extremely beautiful.

verses.kjv: The princes also of Pharaoh saw her, and commended her before Pharaoh: and the woman was taken into Pharaoh’s house.
verses.ct: Pharaoh's officials saw her and praised her to Pharaoh, and she was brought into Pharaoh's palace.

verses.kjv: And he entreated Abram well for her sake: and he had sheep, and oxen, and he asses, and menservants, and maidservants, and she asses, and camels.
verses.ct: Pharaoh treated Abram well because of her, and Abram received sheep, cattle, male donkeys, male servants, female servants, female donkeys, and camels.

verses.kjv: And the LORD plagued Pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of Sarai Abram’s wife.
verses.ct: But the LORD struck Pharaoh and his household with terrible diseases because of Sarai, Abram's wife.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh called Abram, and said, What is this that thou hast done unto me? why didst thou not tell me that she was thy wife?
verses.ct: So Pharaoh summoned Abram and demanded, "What have you done to me? Why didn't you tell me she was your wife?

verses.kjv: Why saidst thou, She is my sister? so I might have taken her to me to wife: now therefore behold thy wife, take her, and go thy way.
verses.ct: Why did you say, 'She is my sister,' so that I took her as my own wife? Here — take your wife and get out of here!"

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh commanded his men concerning him: and they sent him away, and his wife, and all that he had.
verses.ct: Pharaoh gave his men orders regarding Abram, and they escorted him away, along with his wife and everything he owned.
